programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: Austin, Texas, TV executive Steven Beard is shot as he sleeps; with only a single shotgun shell to go on, police follow a trail from mansions and country clubs to bookstores and hospital psych wards.

programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: Penny Scaggs believes in being a dutiful Christian wife and even teaches local women how to build harmonious relationships; she is later found brutally beaten and stabbed beside her beloved yellow piano.

programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: S01/E119 When Susan Wright's husband, Jeffrey, was found buried in the backyard, stabbed 193 times, people dubbed her the blue-eyed butcher of the suburbs.

programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: S01/E120 Bad things happen to the people close to Robert Durst. His wife disappeared without a trace. His best friend was killed in her home.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Dr. Jack Kevorkian claimed his innocence when he testified in his own trial over the accusations of physician-assisted suicides; Dr. Ali Khalili and Merian Frederick sought his services.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.sub-title: Dr. Kevorkian Testifies In His Own Trial
programme.desc: Dr. Jack Kevorkian testified that he regularly turned down people who wanted his end of life services.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.sub-title: The Doctor Is Only There To Help
programme.desc: A defiant doctor Jack Kevorkian made clear to the jury that his patients, like Ali Khalili and Merian Frederick, didn't want to die, but rather they wanted a remedy for their pain and suffering.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The jury got a crash course on medical ethics and the role of treating sick patients; Merian Frederick and Dr. Ali Khalili reached out to Dr. Jack Kevorkian to relieve them of their pain and anguish.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Doctor Jack Kevorkian pushed back on the prosecution's claims that he intended to kill the patients who came to him; he told jurors that Merian Frederick and Dr. Ali Khalili were in daily pain and dying and already near the end.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Dr. Jack Kevorkian claimed that he came to Dr. Ali Khalili and Merian Frederick's aid when no one else could help; Michigan's suicide ban had expired when this trial was going on, but the two deaths occurred when it was in effect.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The jury learned a lot about the field of pathology and the role of a pathologist; that's what Dr. Jack Kevorkian did before he retired; he already had his license revoked when he was there during the suicides of Dr. Ali Khalili and Merian Frederick.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.sub-title: Debate On Medical And Legal Terms
programme.desc: Dr. Jack Kevorkian critiqued the way doctors approach their sick patients; he said they rarely try to alleviate pain and suffering as he did for Dr. Ali Khalili, Merian Frederick, and others.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.desc: A close friend of Bill McGuire testifies about Bill's final days; the State tries to prove that Bill's wife, Melanie, had killed him and then dismembered him; the cross-examination of Jay Tandava heats up.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: Bill's Abandoned Car In Atlantic City
programme.desc: The jury listen to details about Bill McGuire's car that was found in a motel parking lot in Atlantic City days after he went missing; in her first interview with police, Melanie claimed Bill may have been in Atlantic City.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.desc: Prosecutors call Bill McGuire's boss to the stand; Thomas Terry tells the jury that Bill was an excellent worker and was well-respected among his co-workers; according to Terry, Bill's job performance was excellent and was well-respected at work.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.desc: The cross-examination wraps up on Bill McGuire's boss; Thomas Terry confirms that in the days Bill went missing, Melanie called him to ask about life insurance.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.desc: The jury learned about a prescription for a sedative the defendant had filled before her husband, Bill McGuire, went missing; on the stand, under cross examination, was the pharmacist who sold her the drug.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.desc: A forensic toxicologist speaks to jurors about the sedative, chloral hydrate; the State alleges that the defendant, Melanie McGuire, used the drug on her husband, Bill, before shooting, killing, and then dismembering him.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors next hears from the director of the day care where Bill and Melanie McGuire's sons attended; when Melanie is arrested for first-degree murder over a year after Bill died it was after she dropped her kids off at daycare.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.desc: Eight computers and eight cell phones, that's what a forensic computer analyst examined during the murder investigation of Bill McGuire; Jennifer Seymour documented the Internet use and computer activities in Bill.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.desc: The jury learns of more Internet searches done on the family computer before Bill McGuire died; they includes Barbiturates, chloral hydrate, and Walgreens; the powerful sedative chloral hydrate.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.desc: During the murder investigation, detectives find Bill McGuire's car sitting in the parking lot of an Atlantic City motel; he was known to go there to gamble; a crime scene technician who processed Bill's car testifies to the jury.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.desc: Prosecutors introduced a forensic anthropologist to testify about Bill McGuire's remains; Dr. Steven Syms displayed the bones collected and concluded that Bill was dismembered with a thin-blade knife and a power saw.

programme.title: Suitcase Killer Murder Trial
programme.desc: Another forensic toxicologist testified for the prosecution; Dr. George Jackson was the chief toxicologist for the state of New Jersey; he examined the remains of Bill McGuire which had been found in three suitcases.

programme.title: Someone They Knew with Tamron Hall
programme.desc: When drug-addicted casino owner Ted Binion turns up dead in his mansion, the suspects are pure Vegas: an ex-stripper girlfriend, a contractor who knew where his silver was buried, and a mob boss who launders money through his casino.
